style.name: Dry Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

data.name: Spiced Apple Mead
data.description: Apple pie in a glass! Wonderful apple flavor enhanced with spices of cinnamon, clove and nutmeg. Tasty chilled, room temperature or warmed gently in the Crockpot! (Warming, brings out the spice!) Fabulous with turkey dinner, carrot cake or spice cake!
data.foodPairings: Fabulous with turkey dinner, carrot cake or spice cake!

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Regular Hours
Thursdays and Fridays from noon til 6 pm

Saturdays from noon til 6 pm
Meadery tours at 1 pm, 3 pm & 5 pm.

Sundays from 1 pm til 5 pm
Meadery tours at 2 pm & 4 pm.

data.name: Sun Dance - Chardonnay Pyment
data.description: Light, fruity grape notes do not overshadow delightful dryness. Honey source notes are subtly and expertly hidden.Chardonnay grapes from California shine with this bright, surprisingly light and dry pyment. Soft background toasty notes from French Oak barrel, does not overpower but adds just a hint of toasty mystery. Sun Gods & Goddesses rejoice with a chilled one on a hot summer day or relax  with this one on crushed ice on a warm summer evening.

style.name: Dry Mead

Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

breweries.name: Haymaker
breweries.description: We created Haymaker meadery to share our love of meads with friends, family, and friends we have not met yet! Through our years of brewing and mead making we have won numerous awards in competitions and in the past year we took home our first mazer cup at the 2014 competition. We are both BJCP certified judges and continue to judge at local competitions and are active members of our local homebrew club, Stoney Creek Homebrewers based in lower providence township.

data.name: Temerity
data.description: The meaning of Temerity is excessive confidence or boldness; audacity.  This other than standard wine is aged and fermented in our Utopian barrels, for at least six months.  This is one of the most profound wines made from honey you will ever try.  Dry and assertive blackcurrants balanced by the oak.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Thistle
data.description: Our small batch seasonal series of  farmstyle ciders, wines and meads fuse old world oak aging methods with new world flavors and techniques. Farmstyle blends are crafted from locally sourced ingredients and bottled in the traditional style with minimal filtration for pureness of character.

breweries.name: Millstone Cellars
breweries.description: From Farm to Bottle; we source local raw honey, fruits and apples to handcraft intriguing ciders and meads.

data.name: Traditional Honey Wine
data.description: Our Traditional Mead is the simplest form of mead available and is probably the closest you’ll come to what our ancestors produced. Many commercially produced meads that we had tried often seemed overly sweet, so we set out to make something  that would be a little more palatable. Our Traditional Mead is often compared to a Pinot Grigio due to its similar light crisp character, honey-like overtones, and delicate finish. However, the honey flavor is much more  pronounced in our Traditional Mead producing a semi-sweet flavor uninterrupted by the tannins and citrusy aromas produced by grapes. Hosey honey of Midway, Kentuckyis our sole supplier for our honey and it’s  flavor varies depending on the season, providing every bottle with a pleasant element of surprise. Test you wine tasting skills and see if you can detect the difference between the early  blooms of spring from the midsummer clover,  or the early autumn wildflowers. We recommend serving this wine chilled and pairing it the way you would a dry-semisweet white wine.

breweries.name: Louisville Mead Co.
breweries.description: Louisville Mead Co. is a locally owned small-farm winery that produces several varieties honey-based alcoholic beverages known as mead.

data.name: Tupelo Dry Mead
data.description: Tupelo Dry is a traditional mead crafted with 100% raw Tupelo honey, water, and yeast.  Lighter than our semi-sweet Tupelo, this delicate mead allows the more subtle flavors or the rare and world renowned Tupelo honey to take center stage.

style.name: Dry Mead

The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Crafted Artisan Meadery
breweries.description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

data.name: Vanilla Cinnamon
data.description: A sweet mead made with whole cinnamon sticks, vanilla beans and aged on American oak. Each vanilla bean is sliced open by hand before being adding to the mead to ensure maximum flavor extraction.

data.name: Wild
data.description: Pleasurable indulgence unprocessed wildflower honey and wild mountain blue berries.  Get the party started with this one.  Pairs well with fruits, cheese, appetizers or grilled steak tips, the char from the grill really hooks with the honey notes.

breweries.name: Blue Dog Mead
breweries.description:
The oldest beverage on earth just got a facelift. No longer are viking wannabes and medieval enthusiasts the only people who get to knock back a glass of the original liquid sin. Now it’s your turn.

Mead has been around longer than any other drink on the planet, so we’ve had plenty of time to perfect the recipe. Blue Dog Mead is concocted with honey instead of grapes, making it a sweet, refreshing alternative to wine. Not to toot our own horn, but we think with one sip you’ll be hooked.

Our newly designed bottles are made to move, and we don’t just mean off
the shelves. We mean to the beach,in a backpack or while watching a game. You’re mobile and active, so why shouldn’t your drink be? No gimmicks here. Blue Dog just wants to go with you as you grab the 
leash and take life for a good long walk.

So leave history to the vikings and the books, grab yourself some Blue Dog Mead and let’s explore the future of this brand spankin’ old drink together.
